revised_title: Effects of Exercise on Temperature and Circulation: Observations and Findings
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Exercise Physiology
tldr: The author conducted experiments on thirteen males to study the effects of exercise on temperature and circulation. They observed a rise in temperature and pulse rate after physical exertion, indicating that nerve-centers regulating temperature are moderately weakened by the expenditure of force. The results support the idea that the nerve-force plays a significant role in the pulse-rate and temperature regulation during exercise.
